title: About
text:
Cole Henning is a junior at the University of Nebraska- Lincoln majoring in Sports Media and Communications at the College of Journalism.
Throughout his time studying at the University of Nebraska, he has also worked under the Athletic Department with HuskerVision. Preparing himself for the world of live sports broadcasting. Familiarizing himself with running cameras, setting up radio equipment, using EVS replay, and producing for Big Ten Student U.
Cole has worked to develop his coding skills in both high school and college. Focusing on sports data and visualization.

title: Alain Prost Missing Championships
text:
Retroactively applying the current scoring system yields some interesting results. One driver stands out more than any other. That driver is Alain Prost. The current scoring system would add three more championships to his name for a total of seven world championship titles, a record that would go unmatched until 2020 by Lewis Hamilton.
The results speak volumes for the ability and excellence Prost has shown as a driver and the heartbreaking fashion he has lost titles.
The 80s scoring system only counted a driver’s top 11 placed finishes despite 16 races being held a season. The system also awarded on a 9–6–4–3–2–1 basis to the first six finishers in each race. Current scoring counts all races and awards the top 10 drivers on a 25-18-15-12-10-8-6-4-2-1 basis.
First we will look at the 1983 season. Where Prost came two points shy of winning the title under the scoring of the time.


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(waffle)
library(ggtext)
library(cowplot)

results <- read_csv("results.csv")
races <- read_csv("races.csv")
drivers <- read_csv("drivers.csv")

resultsyear <- results %>% left_join(races, by = c("raceId"))
resultsyearID <- resultsyear %>% left_join(drivers, by = c("driverId")) %>%
  mutate(
    name = paste(forename, surname)
  )

resultsfinal <- resultsyearID %>%
  select(name, positionOrder, points, year, round, name) %>%
  mutate(
    newpoints = case_when(
      positionOrder == 1 ~25,
      positionOrder == 2 ~18,
      positionOrder == 3 ~15,
      positionOrder == 4 ~12,
      positionOrder == 5 ~10,
      positionOrder == 6 ~8,
      positionOrder == 7 ~6,
      positionOrder == 8 ~4,
      positionOrder == 9 ~2,
      positionOrder == 10 ~1,
      TRUE ~0
    ) 
  )

eightythree <- resultsfinal %>%
  filter(year == 1983) %>%
  group_by(name)
eightythreesummary <- eightythree %>%
  group_by(name) %>%
  summarise(
    totalpoints = sum(points),
    totalnewpoints = sum(newpoints)
  )

eightythreetop5new <- eightythreesummary %>% 
  arrange(desc(totalnewpoints)) %>% 
  top_n(5) %>% 
  select(name, totalnewpoints)

eightythreetop5old <- eightythreesummary %>% 
  arrange(desc(totalpoints)) %>% 
  top_n(5) %>% 
  select(name, totalpoints)

prostnew <-eightythreetop5new %>% filter(name == "Alain Prost")
prostold <- eightythreetop5old %>% filter(name == "Alain Prost")

bar1 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=eightythreetop5old, aes(x=reorder(name,totalpoints), weight=totalpoints)) +
  geom_bar(data=prostold, aes(x=reorder(name,totalpoints), weight=totalpoints), fill="#c60000") +
  coord_flip() +
labs(title="1983 Championship Standings; Old/New Scoring", subtitle = "Alain Prost would have loved the current point system",  x="", y="Old Points", caption = "") +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 10), 
    plot.subtitle = element_markdown(size=12), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    ) 

bar2 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=eightythreetop5new, aes(x=reorder(name,totalnewpoints), weight=totalnewpoints)) +
  geom_bar(data=prostnew, aes(x=reorder(name,totalnewpoints), weight=totalnewpoints), fill="#C60000") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title="", subtitle = "",  x="", y="New Points", caption = "Source: Wikipedia | By: Cole Henning") +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 10), 
    plot.subtitle = element_markdown(size=12), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    ) 

plot_grid(bar1, bar2, ncol=1) 





The next season Prost found himself in an all too similar scenario losing out on the championship with an even smaller margin of defeat of half a point. Despite finishing with two more wins than rival Nika Lauda.


Code
eightyfour <- resultsfinal %>%
filter(year == 1984) %>%
  group_by(name)

eightyfoursummary <- eightyfour %>%
  group_by(name) %>%
  summarise(
    totalpoints = sum(points),
    totalnewpoints = sum(newpoints)
  )

diff84 <- eightyfour %>% 
  group_by(name) %>% 
  mutate(CumPoints = cumsum(points)) %>%
  mutate(NewCumPoints = cumsum(newpoints))

prost84 <- diff84 %>% filter(name == "Alain Prost")
lauda84 <- diff84 %>% filter(name == "Niki Lauda")

combined <- bind_rows(prost84, lauda84)

ggplot() + 
  geom_step(data=combined, aes(x=round, y=CumPoints, group=name, color=name))+
  geom_step(data=combined, aes(x=round, y=NewCumPoints, group=name, color=name))+
  scale_color_manual(values= c("#c60000", "#005B90"))+
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 230)) + 
  annotate(
    "text", 
    x=14, 
    y=218, 
    label="New Points") +
  annotate(
    "text", 
    x=14, 
    y=80, 
    label="Old Points") +
  labs(
    x="Round", 
    y="Cumulative Points", 
    title="1984 Championship changes hands with modern scoring", 
    subtitle="Modern scoring rewards Prost's consistancy and ability to finish races", 
    caption="Source: Wikipedia | By Cole Henning") +
  theme_minimal()+
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 10), 
    plot.subtitle = element_markdown(size=12), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    ) 





After two heartbreaking championship battles, Prost managed to win two in a row. Shortly after he would lose by three points in 1988 to teammate Aryton Senna. In a season where Prost finished first or second in every race he completed he lost the championship. As Senna secured one more win than Prost to put him over the edge.


Code
eightyeight <- resultsfinal %>%
  filter(year == 1988) %>%
  group_by(name)

eightyeightsummary <- eightyeight %>%
  group_by(name) %>%
  summarise(
    totalpoints = sum(points),
    totalnewpoints = sum(newpoints)
  )

prost <- c("Old Points"=87, "New Points"=214)
senna <- c("Old Points"=90, "New Points"=185, 26)

iron(
 waffle(prost, 
        rows = 10, 
        xlab="Prost", 
        colors = c("black", "#c60000"))+
   labs(
     title="1988 Hindsight Title Fight", 
     subtitle="Senna shines under the old scoring;
Prost wishing the full resume was considered") + 
   theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 10),
    axis.title.y = element_blank()
    ),
 waffle(senna, 
        rows = 10, 
        xlab="Senna\n1 square = 1 point", 
        colors = c("black", "#EDD35A", "white"))+
   labs(caption="Source: Wikipedia | Graphic by Cole Henning")
)





While the past can’t be changed, Prost’s career is one filled with what-ifs. He made a living and won four championships off of his consistently elite driving. The scoring system of the time truly fails to show his ability as a driver.
After looking at these results I can’t help but wonder that if the current point system had been in place, would we be talking about Prost in the same conversations as Michael Schumacher and Lewis Hamilton

title: Blog
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.3.6     ✔ purrr   0.3.4
✔ tibble  3.1.8     ✔ dplyr   1.0.9
✔ tidyr   1.2.0     ✔ stringr 1.4.1
✔ readr   2.1.2     ✔ forcats 0.5.2
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()

library(waffle)
library(ggtext)
library(cowplot)

Next we will load our data in

results <- read_csv("results.csv")

Warning: One or more parsing issues, see `problems()` for details


Rows: 25660 Columns: 18
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (8): position, positionText, time, milliseconds, fastestLap, rank, fast...
dbl (10): resultId, raceId, driverId, constructorId, number, grid, positionO...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

races <- read_csv("races.csv")

Rows: 1079 Columns: 18
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (13): name, time, url, fp1_date, fp1_time, fp2_date, fp2_time, fp3_date...
dbl   (4): raceId, year, round, circuitId
date  (1): date

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

drivers <- read_csv("drivers.csv")

Rows: 854 Columns: 9
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (7): driverRef, number, code, forename, surname, nationality, url
dbl  (1): driverId
date (1): dob

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Now we will join our two dataframes together using left_join

resultsyear <- results %>% left_join(races, by = c("raceId"))


resultsyearID <- resultsyear %>% left_join(drivers, by = c("driverId")) %>%
  mutate(
    name = paste(forename, surname)
  )


resultsfinal <- resultsyearID %>%
  select(name, positionOrder, points, year, round, name) %>%
  mutate(
    newpoints = case_when(
      positionOrder == 1 ~25,
      positionOrder == 2 ~18,
      positionOrder == 3 ~15,
      positionOrder == 4 ~12,
      positionOrder == 5 ~10,
      positionOrder == 6 ~8,
      positionOrder == 7 ~6,
      positionOrder == 8 ~4,
      positionOrder == 9 ~2,
      positionOrder == 10 ~1,
      TRUE ~0
    ) 
  )


eightythree <- resultsfinal %>%
  filter(year == 1983) %>%
  group_by(name)


head(eightythree)

# A tibble: 6 × 6
# Groups:   name [6]
  name            positionOrder points  year round newpoints
  <chr>                   <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>
1 Nelson Piquet               1      9  1983     1        25
2 Niki Lauda                  2      4  1983     1        18
3 Jacques Laffite             3      3  1983     1        15
4 Patrick Tambay              4      2  1983     1        12
5 Marc Surer                  5      1  1983     1        10
6 Alain Prost                 6      0  1983     1         8



eightythreesummary <- eightythree %>%
  group_by(name) %>%
  summarise(
    totalpoints = sum(points),
    totalnewpoints = sum(newpoints)
  )


eightythreetop5new <- eightythreesummary %>% 
  arrange(desc(totalnewpoints)) %>% 
  top_n(5) %>% 
  select(name, totalnewpoints)

Selecting by totalnewpoints



eightythreetop5old <- eightythreesummary %>% 
  arrange(desc(totalpoints)) %>% 
  top_n(5) %>% 
  select(name, totalpoints)

Selecting by totalnewpoints



prostnew <-eightythreetop5new %>% filter(name == "Alain Prost")
prostold <- eightythreetop5old %>% filter(name == "Alain Prost")


bar1 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=eightythreetop5old, aes(x=reorder(name,totalpoints), weight=totalpoints)) +
  geom_bar(data=prostold, aes(x=reorder(name,totalpoints), weight=totalpoints), fill="#c60000") +
  coord_flip() +
labs(title="1983 Championship Standings", subtitle = "Alain Prost would have loved the current point system",  x="", y="Old Points", caption = "") +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 10), 
    plot.subtitle = element_markdown(size=12), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    ) 


bar2 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=eightythreetop5new, aes(x=reorder(name,totalnewpoints), weight=totalnewpoints)) +
  geom_bar(data=prostnew, aes(x=reorder(name,totalnewpoints), weight=totalnewpoints), fill="#C60000") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title="", subtitle = "",  x="", y="New Points", caption = "Source: Wikipedia | By: Cole Henning") +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 10), 
    plot.subtitle = element_markdown(size=12), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    ) 


plot_grid(bar1, bar2, ncol=1) 





eightyfour <- resultsfinal %>%
filter(year == 1984) %>%
  group_by(name)


eightyfoursummary <- eightyfour %>%
  group_by(name) %>%
  summarise(
    totalpoints = sum(points),
    totalnewpoints = sum(newpoints)
  )


diff84 <- eightyfour %>% 
  group_by(name) %>% 
  mutate(CumPoints = cumsum(points)) %>%
  mutate(NewCumPoints = cumsum(newpoints))


prost84 <- diff84 %>% filter(name == "Alain Prost")
lauda84 <- diff84 %>% filter(name == "Niki Lauda")


combined <- bind_rows(prost84, lauda84)

ggplot() + 
  geom_step(data=combined, aes(x=round, y=CumPoints, group=name, color=name))+
  geom_step(data=combined, aes(x=round, y=NewCumPoints, group=name, color=name))+
  scale_color_manual(values= c("#c60000", "#005B90"))+
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 230)) + 
  annotate(
    "text", 
    x=14, 
    y=218, 
    label="New Points") +
  annotate(
    "text", 
    x=14, 
    y=80, 
    label="Old Points") +
  labs(
    x="Round", 
    y="Cumulative Points", 
    title="1984 Championship changes hands with modern scoring", 
    subtitle="Modern scoring rewards Prost's consistancy and ability to finish races", 
    caption="Source: Wikipedia | By Cole Henning") +
  theme_minimal()+
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 10), 
    plot.subtitle = element_markdown(size=12), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    ) 




converting…

eightyeight <- resultsfinal %>%
  filter(year == 1988) %>%
  group_by(name)


eightyeightsummary <- eightyeight %>%
  group_by(name) %>%
  summarise(
    totalpoints = sum(points),
    totalnewpoints = sum(newpoints)
  )


prost <- c("Old Points"=87, "New Points"=214)
senna <- c("Old Points"=90, "New Points"=185, 26)


iron(
 waffle(prost, 
        rows = 10, 
        xlab="Prost", 
        colors = c("black", "#c60000"))+
   labs(
     title="1988 Hindsight Title Fight", 
     subtitle="Senna shines under the old scoring;
Prost wishing the full resume was considered") + 
   theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 10),
    axis.title.y = element_blank()
    ),
 waffle(senna, 
        rows = 10, 
        xlab="Senna\n1 square = 1 point", 
        colors = c("black", "#EDD35A", "white"))+
   labs(caption="Source: Wikipedia | Graphic by Cole Henning")
)
